programme.title: World of Giants
programme.desc: A mission to get documents takes Hunter and Winters to a warehouse office; Winters gets Hunter in, dodging the guard, but the guard returns too soon, and a shootout leaves Hunter alone, who tries to call HQ on a telephone 20 times his size.

programme.title: World of Giants
programme.desc: Mel is in the house alone when a suspicious ticking package arrives; he must get to Bill in the garage, but it means venturing outdoors alone for the first time since shrinking.

programme.title: World of Giants
programme.desc: Commissioner Hall assigns Mel and Bill to interrogate espionage courier and former actress, Sally Thomas, in the hope of uncovering a new apparatus in Washington, and its suspected head, Erik Janker.

programme.title: World of Giants
programme.desc: Bill is involved in an auto accident; his briefcase cannot be found later.

programme.title: World of Giants
programme.desc: Mel and Bill investigate a casino being used to make payoffs to foreign spies.

programme.title: World of Giants
programme.desc: On a mission to catch some yttrium thieves, the thieves hide the yttrium in a briefcase -- along with Mel -- and flee with the briefcase.

programme.title: World of Giants
programme.desc: In order to stop a spy from using carrier pigeons to send microfilm to a foreign agent, Bill sends Mel into the dovecote.

programme.title: World of Giants
programme.desc: Assigned to uncover a new espionage code, Mel and Bill tail a courier, Delgado, from the Miami Airport to a swank estate.

programme.title: World of Giants
programme.desc: A missile launches from Cape Canaveral, but it runs wild and goes down in the Caribbean area; the missile contains a newly developed mechanism that must not fall into foreign hands.

programme.title: World of Giants
programme.desc: Bill and Mel fly to Hong Kong to break up a ring smuggling Chinese Nationals off China mainland.

programme.title: World of Giants
programme.desc: Bill discovers that a pharmacist at the local drugstore is an ex-convict involved in a lonely hearts racket; during a routine investigation, Mel learns the man is preying on Sandra, the wife of the drugstore proprietor.

programme.title: World of Giants
programme.desc: In an attempt to expose criminal organizations, an experiment is conducted wherein Mel Hunter, an American counterespionage agent, is reduced in height to only six inches, thus enabling him to go places and do things that normal agents cannot.

programme.title: Warning From Space
programme.desc: Huge one-eyed star-shaped aliens come to Tokyo to save Earth from hitting a flaming planet.

programme.title: The 27th Day
programme.desc: An alien from a dying planet selects five humans to carry capsules powerful enough to wipe out mankind.

programme.title: One Step Beyond
programme.desc: A soldier and his wife have unexplained dreams.

programme.title: One Step Beyond
programme.desc: The ghost of a former fighter warns an aging boxer not to go through with a championship bout.

programme.title: Superman
programme.desc: A petty thief wears a Superman costume to commit robberies and convinces Metropolis that Superman has gone rogue.

programme.title: The Vise
programme.desc: Pinehurst Cemetery workers start digging up several graves after a mishap, and are shocked by what they find inside John Dylan's coffin.

programme.title: The Vise
programme.desc: The exploits of Mark Saber, a one-armed Chief Inspector of Scotland Yard.

programme.title: The Vise
programme.desc: When the police seem to offer no hope, Mark Saber must help Petra Tomulkin find her father who was kidnapped in a diplomatic vehicle.

programme.title: The Vise
programme.desc: Mark investigates the possibility of a connection between an antique dealer's mysterious death and a seemingly ordinary jewel case.

programme.title: The Vise
programme.desc: Tony Hollister suspects that his cousin Angela gave him a bottle of poisoned liquor. He immediately decides to get its contents tested to establish whether he is right.
